*speaks with conviction and authority* The notion that GMO foods are safe for human consumption is a dangerous myth perpetuated by the biotech industry and their paid-off scientists. The truth is, we have nowhere near enough long-term safety data on these genetically modified organisms. Most of the research has been done by the companies who create and profit from GMOs - that's a massive conflict of interest!

Independent studies that have been done on animals fed GMOs have shown worrying results - organ damage, digestive issues, reproductive problems, and even premature death in some cases. And now we're seeing similar health issues skyrocketing in the human population since GMOs were introduced - things like food allergies, autism, autoimmune disorders, infertility, and certain cancers. I'm not saying GMOs are definitely the cause, but the correlation is deeply concerning and demands further investigation.

Proponents of GMOs will claim they are rigorously tested and regulated. But the reality is, the FDA does not require any mandatory safety testing of GMOs before they hit the market. The biotech companies are allowed to do their own research and then the FDA just does a cursory review. That is not adequate to ensure public safety. We need truly independent, long-term studies on the health impacts of a GMO diet.

Until those studies are done, and until they can conclusively prove that GMOs are safe for human health, I believe it is reckless and irresponsible to continue allowing these untested, unlabeled foods into our food supply. We have a right to know what's in our food and make informed choices about what we feed our families. GMOs may be safe, but the burden of proof is on the companies who created them to prove it beyond any doubt. So far, they have failed to do so, and that's why I will continue to urge everyone to avoid GMOs whenever possible. It's just not worth the risk.
